title.narrative: OPT 2.6.2: CP SYSTEM

description.narrative: 2.6.2 Children and adolescent victims of all forms of violence, abuse and negligence in priority areas have access to institutional protection services, with a focus on gender and interculturality, which contributes to Access To Justice, Birth Registration, Child Protection Systems, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 2.6 By 2017, children and adolescents, especially the most vulnerable, are protected by a judicial framework that is aligned with international standards and have access to protection programs and services (including timely birth registration), that prevent and protect them from violence, negligence, abuse and exploitation

participating-org.narrative: UNIDAD DE ANALISIS DE POLITICAS SOC Y ECONOMICAS

sector.narrative: Birth Registration/Civil Registration and Vital Statistics systems
Social welfare workforce systems strengthening (accreditation, staffing and supervision)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 2.6.2 Children and adolescent victims of all forms of violence, abuse and negligence in priority areas have access toinstitutional protection services, with a focus on gender and interculturality

description.narrative: UNICEF developed training processes and protocols to strengthen institutional capacities, establish procedures, design protocols, and promote coordination within the child protection system, in accordance with the Child and Adolescent&39;s Act and its Regulations. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:20/12/2017
